FuncDef:
The clock ssm command configures an SSM level for a line clock source.
The undo clock ssm command deletes the SSM level configured for a line clock source. The clock ssm command configures an SSM level for a line clock source. The undo clock ssm command deletes the SSM level configured for a line clock source. By default, the line clock source learns SSM levels sent by an upstream device. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H-48S6CQ, CE6881H-48S6CQ-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: clock ssm { unk | prc | ssua | ssub | sec | dnu }
ParentView: 100GE interface view,10GE interface view,200GE interface view,25GE interface view,400GE interface view,50GE interface view

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that the SSM level is unknown clock synchronization quality.
-

Indicates that the SSM level is PRC (G.811 clock signal).
-

Indicates that the SSM level is SSUA (G.812 transit node clock signal).
-

Indicates that the SSM level is SSUB (G.812 local node clock signal).
-

Indicates that the SSM level is SDH.
-

Indicates that the SSM level is not used for clock synchronization.
-
